newsitem.title: USA: Dell Computer cuts Optiplex PC prices.
newsitem.headline: Dell Computer cuts Optiplex PC prices.

text.p: Dell Computer Corp said on Thursday that it had reduced U.S. prices by up to 16 percent for its corporate OptiPlex desktop personal computers.
Dell, a major supplier of PCs to corporate America, added that it already had lowered OptiPlex prices three times this year.
The price cut, the latest in a computer pricing war to sweep the industry, includes systems featuring the Intel Pentium processor with MMX technology, the computer maker said in a statement.

"Today's price adjustment places select Dell's OptiPlex PCs up to 25 percent below comparable systems offered by some of our major competitors," said Kevin Rollins, senior vice president of Dell Americas.
Rollins added that the lower prices would pass on to customers savings from lower component costs and operational efficiencies.
Dell stock traded at 149-1/8, up 1-3/8 on the day.
